page.title: 13WINTER CONDITIONS
page.content: The worst winter I can remember was 1983-4. There had been a severe frost and a lot of snow. On January 1st one of our electricity poles was hit by lightning. Our house had a power cut which lasted for four and a half days. The first day we managed to cook our tea on the coal fire but the next day we got the loan of a gas cooker from a neighbour. This area is very exposed and often people remember the severe gales rather than the effects of snow. In this same winter there were Force 12 winds battering the coastline. Several caravans were completed flattened or overturned, luckily they were empty at the time. This last winter there was hardly any snow.In fact the whole of February was completely snow-free. It was quite annoying not being able to play in it.
